title: Artifact: The Dota-Uh, I mean Legends of Runeterra! The League of Legends Card Game!

replies.body:
People who like LoL and TCGs might enjoy it. Personally, I absolutely cannot stand TCGs ("oh look, my deck starts with all resources or all units so I'll lose before making a single play"), so I won't play it.

I'm actually not excited about any of the recent announcements. :(

>
> People who like LoL and TCGs might enjoy it. Personally, I absolutely cannot stand TCGs ("oh look, my deck starts with all resources or all units so I'll lose before making a single play"), so I won't play it.
> 
> I'm actually not excited about any of the recent announcements. :(

Yeah and I feel like most of the card games are all the same, maybe a couple of tiny quirks that make it "original".

Also, I don't think anyone wanted LoL Mobile, and TFT should of started as a mobile game, so you aren't alone on that haha

I am looking forward to it. Artifact flopped because a.) the market system in it was awful and b.) it was very complex for a genre where the most played archetype is Aggro/Burn often. The games took very long too, which isnt what most card game players want.

This seems much simpler, and people are more attached to League lore and characters than Dota characters.

I will admit, the lore that the cards in this game provides is really interesting and does flesh out the LoL universe.

I definitely will try the game, but card games aren't my favorite type of game, I've tried Hearthstone but I'd imagine it's not the same. I could be surprised though.
nope, not going to be playing that dumpster fire
